channel.title: Lamb on Cooking
channel.description: Recent content in Lamb on Cooking

item.title: Lamb Biriyani
item.description: This recipe makes an Southern Indian (Tamil) style Lamb biriyani that has been adapted to a more western audience (aka a bit less spicy) and can be made with either Lamb or Mutton. Best served with a sauce such as an Onion Raitha website. A plated rendering of the dish, made with Mutton. Makes a really hearty ,meaty and delicious dish. The dishes uses a rice to meat ratio of 2:3.

item.title: Shepherd's Pie
item.description: ‚è≤Ô∏è Prep time: 50 - 60 min üç≥ Cook time: 30 - 40 min üçΩÔ∏è Servings: 8 Ingredients 600 grams (g) of mealy/floury potatoes 2 onions 2 carrots 4 tablespoons (tbsp.) of oil 800 g of minced lamb 100 g of frozen peas 2 tbsp. of tomato paste/puree 300 milliliters (ml) beef stock 1 tbsp. of sweet or smoked paprika 30 g of butter 200 ml of milk 1 pinch of nutmeg Directions Peel potatoes, cut into cubes and boil in saltwater for 20 minutes.

item.title: Traditional beef or lamb stew
item.description: This is a recipe for a typical Irish stew. This is traditionally made with lamb since it’s cheaper however, beef tastes a lot better and is more readily available in North America I’ve been told. This is good if you want to feed a family or if you just want to be lazy and eat the same thing for 2 or 3 days. Besides browning the meat this is really just throwing stuff into a pot in a certain order.

item.title: Tuh'u
item.description: Tuh’u (Akkadian for possibly “beetroot”) is an ancient Mesopotamian spring festival dish, a lamb stew of sorts, extracted by historians at Yale Babylonian Collection from tablets from Babylonia, ca. 1740 BC. ‚è≤Ô∏è Prep time: 30 min üç≥ Cook time: 60-90 min üçΩÔ∏è Servings: 3 Ingredients 450 g of lamb leg meat, diced 4 tbsp of sesame oil, olive oil, or rendered fat 350 mL of prepared water 350 mL of sour-tasting beer (e.
